The recent passage of the CARES Act provided critical assistance for individuals, businesses, and essential services, and we are starting to see these resources delivered to Hawai‘i.

On #NationalGoForBrokeDay, we remember the spirit + sacrifice of the 442nd on the day the unit’s first Medal of Honor recipient, PFC Sadao Munemori, was killed 75 years ago. We are inspired by the Aloha they embodied & confront hatred & bigotry with courage, love, & respect.

There is a shortage of blood donations on O‘ahu. Residents can leave their homes to donate blood, and the Blood Bank of Hawai‘i has created a safe donation environment to collect the necessary blood to sustain our community. Learn more: https://t.co/wkginAgcjx

I am working with leaders in Congress to make sure Hawai‘i’s farmers, rural communities, and homeowners are secure through this crisis, families and workers can afford to put food on the table, and that we stand against the anti-Asian bigotry surrounding this pandemic.
The coronavirus crisis is impacting us and our communities in ways we could not imagine. https://t.co/i9Wb8jrCsz

As a fellow Soldier in the National Guard, I am grateful for all of my brothers and sisters in the National Guard who are mobilizing across the country to serve! I stand ready to serve should the Hawaii National Guard be activated.

For years, I have pushed for paper ballots to ensure our elections are secure. In this coronavirus pandemic, it’s even more important that we quickly transition to a mail-in paper ballot, which would allow more people to vote & protect their health & the security of their vote.

Thank you for tuning in to my telephone town hall with Dr. Scott Miscovich to discuss the COVID-19 coronavirus crisis yesterday. If you missed it, you can listen online or watch on Facebook: https://t.co/xsWzSSiUUr

Today is Census Day! Fill out the census safely from your home by mail, phone, or online. Counting everyone is critical, as it will determine the public health funding that our community gets for the next decade - so important right now. Learn more: https://t.co/gvJlFyL07p

Join me + @LtGovJoshGreen for a live telephone town hall tomorrow, 3/18 from 4–5pm HST to talk about the local + national response to the coronavirus. We look forward to speaking directly with you + sharing the latest information. Call (888) 476-4187 to participate. Aloha.

Tonight, I voted to pass the Families First Coronavirus Response Act. In the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, this emergency funding package will begin to provide relief to working Americans and their families across the country so they can focus on their health and well-being.

I’ve introduced a resolution that prioritizes people so our economic relief is placed directly into the hands of every American, rather than getting stuck in bureaucracy or ending up in the pockets of big corporations.

Instead, we must act swiftly to provide a temporary universal basic payment of $1,000 per month to every American adult to help them weather the storm created by this crisis. Taking care of all Americans will stimulate our economy during this downturn.

The coronavirus pandemic has created a threat to the health and well-being of the American people, as well as to our country’s economic stability. While some in Washington are focused on taking care of Wall Street, everyday Americans get left behind. That’s wrong.

Today, I introduced a resolution that provides for a universal basic payment to help Americans across the country weather the storm caused by the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic.
https://t.co/wag9KimCND
The letter also urged the Administration to work with Congress to provide economic relief to all affected passengers.

I sent a letter to Pres. Trump calling for a temporary suspension of cruise line operations nationwide until there are proper procedures available to ensure that all people can be tested for COVID-19 & cleared before boarding or disembarking cruise ships. https://t.co/EVuCxPnXYJ

When President Trump committed an illegal and unconstitutional act of war against Iran, he undermined both our national security and our Constitution. This vote today is on behalf of the American people and the Constitution of the United States.

Our nation’s founders endowed Congress with the grave responsibility of deciding whether or not to declare war. They recognized how dangerous it would be for one individual to be endowed with the unilateral power to start a war.

Today, I voted to pass legislation that demands the end of military action against Iran without Congressional authorization and reasserts the Constitutional authority of Congress to declare war.
https://t.co/OkbVIu84cj

Attention high school artists: the 2020 Kaha Kiʻi Congressional Art Competition is now open! The competition is open to all high school students in Hawaiʻi's 2nd Congressional District. The deadline is Fri 4/3 at 6pm. We can't wait to see your creativity! https://t.co/NfcXHQVzdz

While more must be done, it’s essential that we stand together as Americans to defeat the threat of this virus. The Senate must quickly act to pass this bill to ensure these resources get to those who need them to ensure the safety and well-being of the American people.

It will fund the ability to ensure the availability of testing wherever needed, masks & hygiene tools for healthcare professionals, nursing homes, & first responders as well as expanding tele-health services to prevent the spread of this virus.

Today, I voted for legislation that will provide emergency funds to address the coronavirus, which passed with a strong show of bipartisan support. This funding is extremely important to Hawai‘i & states across the country. https://t.co/lwjOHPDnSE

This left states like Hawai'i, home to over 16,000 FAS migrants, forced to try to cover the gap of this unfunded Federal mandate. The Federal Government should live up to the spirit of the Compact of Free Association and fix this mistake.

Nearly 40,000 FAS migrants reside across the United States.  Due to an error in the text of a 1996 law, access promised to the FAS migrants by the federal government to vital programs like Medicaid, school, and child nutrition programs were stripped.
Last week, I introduced H.R. 5950, the FAS School Meals Improvement Act. https://t.co/UaGQjbQ27X

Unfortunately, there are still hate crimes being committed, like the shooting of peaceful parishioners at a Bible study at the Mother Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, and the violence in Charlottesville.
Lynching is not only about murder, but also about sowing fear and stoking the flames of hatred and bigotry.

I was humbled to cast my vote today, over 100 years since the first anti-lynching bill was introduced in Congress, joining nearly all Members of Congress, standing together to pass H.R.35, the Emmett Till Antilynching Act. https://t.co/02UqEumojn

We must look at creative solutions that will ensure our veterans get the VIP treatment they deserve. This bill will explore an innovative way to provide the experienced leadership to help improve the care of our brothers and sisters who’ve served.
Veterans in Hawai'i and across the country are still struggling to get the benefits they’ve earned through their service and sacrifice.

Yesterday, I introduced a bipartisan bill with Rep. Brian Mast (FL). Our veterans deserve the best care and service that our nation can provide. Unfortunately, that’s not what we have today.
https://t.co/xOilXjEHnN

Today, we honor civil rights activist Fred Korematsu, who fought against the internment of Japanese Americans during WWII. His bravery in the face of injustice – standing up to what he knew was wrong, taking his case to the Supreme Court – inspires those fighting injustice today. https://t.co/1fNZjsMZ5T

We also took action to repeal the 2002 AUMF against Iraq so it can no longer be perverted & misused as an excuse to wage more wasteful regime change wars that do not make us any safer. We are not at war with Iraq. This outdated AUMF is a relic of the past & must be repealed now.

Our legislation today would stop President Trump from waging yet another unconstitutional and illegal war against Iran by prohibiting the use of funding for such a war without Congressional authorization.

Our nation’s founders understood the danger of placing the decision to go to war in the hands of one individual — which is why they made sure our Constitution provided that responsibility to Congress.

Congress is taking back its Constitutional authority in another step towards ending Presidential wars. As a soldier and veteran of two Middle East deployments, I’ve seen the cost of war and who pays the price.

Today, I voted to pass legislation that would prevent the U.S. from going to war with Iran without Congressional authorization, as well as repeal the 2002 Authorization for the Use of Military Force (AUMF) in Iraq.
https://t.co/Z0xtlFWpEX

Today marks the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz. I'll #neverforget my visit there and the horrors committed at that concentration camp. We must remember the past and stand firmly against hatred, antisemitism, and religious bigotry.

I introduced H.R.5612, the Small Business & Community Investments Expansion Act to boost the ability of local financial institutions to provide entrepreneurs, farmers and families with the resources that will help strengthen communities across the nation.
https://t.co/himdK1HQrH

Community financial institutions and credit unions reach underserved communities across the country. Small businesses and farmers are the backbone of our nation and vital to America’s economic well-being.

"Through violence you may murder a hater, but you can't murder hate through violence. Darkness cannot put out darkness; only light can do that."
https://t.co/Ah9LpatoqH

The Rev. Martin Luther King, Jr. embodied the spirit of aloha. What binds us together is greater than what tears us apart and we must overcome prejudice to do so. Among our own communities and as we engage others in the world, we must remember his words:

While we all mourn the heartbreaking loss of two of Honolulu’s finest, their fellow first responders are still out there. Our prayers are with the families of the officers we lost, and with first responders still working to keep our communities safe.
The harmful effects are felt in our veteran and military family community — many of whom were exposed to the chemicals that were used at military installations.
PFAS contamination sites blanket the map, affecting almost every state and PFAS chemicals have been implicated in cancer and other illnesses.

Every American in every community across our country deserves clean water. That is why I voted for and strongly support the passage of the PFAS Action Act today.
https://t.co/fTWNpWJ5vD

Number two, our troops in Iraq are no longer focusing on preventing a resurgence of ISIS and Al-Qaeda, instead all of their efforts are now focused on Iranian forces and Iranian-backed Shia militias.

In doing so, he has undermined our national security in two critical ways. Number one, Iran is no longer complying with the Iran Nuclear Agreement and is quickly speeding forward in developing their nuclear weapons capability, putting us and the world at greater risk.

President Trump has committed an illegal and unconstitutional act of war, pushing our nation headlong into a war with Iran without any authorization from Congress — a war so devastating and costly it would make our wars in Iraq and Afghanistan look like a picnic.

Today, I voted to pass H.Con.Res.83, a war powers resolution demanding the end of military action against Iran without Congressional authorization.
https://t.co/G0EnHmmV1A

I urge Congress to pass H.Res.411, the No More Presidential Wars resolution, to restore Constitutional balance and ensure Congress fulfills its responsibility to determine whether or not to declare war.  https://t.co/2j1JKs7AUC
Trump’s action will drag us deeper into war with Iran that will be far more costly and devastating than the wars in Iraq, Syria or Afghanistan. We must get our troops out of Iraq and Syria now.
The president committed an act of war without authorization from Congress. It is a fundamental violation of the Constitution.
